Base.Explanation: Get the value of an attribute of an Active Directory object, for instance a user account. The attribute is specified by the LDAP display name of the attribute. For the most common properties, the LDAP name can be selected from a list.

ArrayElement.Name: User Object
ArrayElement.Description: A data structure representing a user account. If you want to obtain the property of a user account object, you can use this property to specify the Active Directory object for this action. Use the action 'Get user (AD)' to find the user account in Active Directory and setup the variable that contains the 'User Object'.

ArrayElement.Name: Active Directory Object
ArrayElement.Description: A data structure representing a Active Directory object for which an attribute must obtained. This property can only be used as a input variable. Earlier in the script, another script action must have generated the value for this variable.

ArrayElement.Name: LDAP attribute display name
ArrayElement.Description: The LDAP name of the attribute. The name identifies the attribute of the Active Directory object. For a number of well-known attributes, the LDAP name can be selected from a list but you can specify any other valid name.

ArrayElement.Name: Multi-value flag
ArrayElement.Description: Save multi-values as multi-values for the attribute. If set to 'Yes' and the attribute is multi-valued, the values are stored as multi-values (text list or table). If set to 'No' and the attribute is multi-valued, the values are converted into a single value. Default value: 'No'.

ArrayElement.Name: Convert to text flag
ArrayElement.Description: Convert the value(s) of the attribute to text. Default value: 'Yes'. If set, depending on property 'Multi-value flag', the result is either a single text or text list. If not set ('No'), the results is stored as one of the UMRA supported data types.

ArrayElement.Name: Error if no attribute found
ArrayElement.Description: Generate an error for this script action if the specified attribute is not found.

ArrayElement.Name: Error if empty
ArrayElement.Description: Generate an error for this script action if the attribute is found but attribute value is empty.

ArrayElement.Name: Attribute value
ArrayElement.Description: The value found for the attribute. This property is an 'output only' property and is generated by the application automatically. By default, the value for this property is stored in variable %AttributeValue%.

Base.Explanation: Edit the existing Exchange 2003/2000 mailbox of a user account. The user account and mailbox must already exist. To edit additional attributes of the user account, use the action 'Edit user (AD)'.

ArrayElement.Name: User Object
ArrayElement.Description: A data structure representing the user account. The property is used to identifiy the user account for the mailbox and is normally generated as a variable by a previous script action ('Get user (AD)').

ArrayElement.Name: Alias
ArrayElement.Description: The Alias property specifies the alias used for E-mail address generation. By default, E-mail addresses are generated based on the name of the user account automatically.

ArrayElement.Name: E-mail addresses
ArrayElement.Description: The E-mail addresses specified for the Exchange mailbox. By default, the E-mail addresses are generated automatically when the mailbox is created. By specifying this property you can configure additional E-mail addresses.

ArrayElement.Name: Auto-update E-mail addresses
ArrayElement.Description: The E-mail addresses for the Exchange mailbox can be generated according to the recipient's policy by specifying this option.

ArrayElement.Name: Hide from address book
ArrayElement.Description: The property specifies whether the recipient is displayed in the address book.

Base.Explanation: Edit the attributes of an existing mailbox.

Base.Name: Identity
Base.Description: The Identity parameter identifies the mailbox. Use for example the distinguished name (CN=jsmith,OU=sales,DC=tools4ever,DC=com), the domain\account name (tools4ever.com\Jsmith), the alias (JSmith), the User principal name (JSmith@tools4ever.com) or GUID.

Base.Name: Accept messages only from
Base.Description: The 'Accept messages only from' parameter specifies the mailbox users, mail users and mail contacts that can send e-mail messages to this mailbox. The AcceptMessagesOnlyFrom parameter supports any of the following input formats: the distinguished name (CN=jsmith,OU=sales,DC=tools4ever,DC=com), the domain\account name (tools4ever.com\Jsmith), the username (JohnSmith), the alias (JSmith), the display name (John Smith), the User principal name (JSmith@tools4ever.com) or the GUID. Use commas to specify multiple values.

Base.Name: Alias
Base.Description: The Alias parameter specifies the alias (mail nickname) of the user. The alias can be a combination of characters separated by a period with no intervening spaces. Do not use special characters in the alias.

Base.Name: Anti spam bypass enabled
Base.Description: The 'Anti spam bypass enabled' parameter specifies whether to skip anti-spam processing on this mailbox.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 1
Base.Description: The 'Custom attribute 1' parameter specifies the value for the mailbox attribute CustomAttribute1.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 2
Base.Description: The 'Custom attribute 2' parameter specifies the value for the mailbox attribute CustomAttribute2.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 3
Base.Description: The 'Custom attribute 3' parameter specifies the value for the mailbox attribute CustomAttribute3.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 4
Base.Description: The 'Custom attribute 4' parameter specifies the value for the mailbox attribute CustomAttribute4.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 5
Base.Description: The 'Custom attribute 5' parameter specifies the value for the mailbox attribute CustomAttribute5.

Base.Name: Deliver to mailbox and forward
Base.Description: The 'Deliver to mailbox and forward' parameter specifies whether messages are sent to both this mailbox and the forwarding address.

Base.Name: Display name
Base.Description: The 'Display name' parameter specifies the display name for the user account associated with this mailbox. The display name is used by Microsoft Outlook.

Base.Name: Domain controller
Base.Description: Optional value. The name of the domain controller to use to retrieve the data from Active Directory directory service. Use the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the domain controller. For example: EXCHSERVER.tools4ever.com.

Base.Name: Email addresses
Base.Description: The 'Email addresses' parameter specifies all the proxy addresses of the mailbox. It includes the primary Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) address as one of the proxy addresses. Use commas to specify multiple values.

Base.Name: Emailaddress policy enabled
Base.Description: The 'Emailaddress policy enabled' parameter specifies whether the e-mail address policy for this mailbox is enabled.

Base.Name: External Out of Office options
Base.Description: The 'External Out of Office options' parameter specifies the option for sending an Out of Office message to external senders. Use one of the following values: 'External' and 'InternalOnly'.

Base.Name: Forwarding address
Base.Description: The 'Forwarding address' parameter specifies a forwarding address. Use for example: domain.com/Sales/JSmith. If 'Deliver to mailbox and forward' is set to $true, messages that are sent to this mailbox will be forwarded to the address specified.

Base.Name: Hidden from addresslists enabled
Base.Description: The 'Hidden from addresslists enabled' parameter specifies whether this mailbox is hidden from other address lists.

Base.Name: Issue warning quota
Base.Description: The 'Issue warning quota' parameter specifies the mailbox size at which a warning message is sent to the user. Qualify the value with one of the following: B (bytes), KB (kilobytes), MB (megabytes), GB (gigabytes) or "unlimited". If this attribute is set on a mailbox, it overrides the default value that is set for this attribute on the mailbox database.

Base.Name: Maximum blocked senders
Base.Description: The 'Maximum blocked senders' parameter specifies the maximum number of senders that can be included in the blocked senders list. Blocked senders are senders that are considered junk senders by the mailbox user and are used in junk e-mail rules. This parameter is only validated when the junk e-mail rules are updated using Outlook Web Access or Web services.

Base.Name: Maximum receive size
Base.Description: The 'Maximum receive size' parameter specifies the maximum size of messages that this mailbox can receive. Qualify the value with one of the following: B (bytes), KB (kilobytes), MB (megabytes), GB (gigabytes) or "unlimited".

Base.Name: Maximum safe senders
Base.Description: The 'Maximum safe senders' parameter specifies the maximum number of senders that can be included in the safe senders list. Safe senders are senders that are trusted by the mailbox user and are used in junk e-mail rules. This parameter is only validated when the junk e-mail rules are updated using Outlook Web Access or Web services.

Base.Name: Maximum send size
Base.Description: The 'Maximum send size' parameter specifies the maximum size of messages that this mailbox can send. Qualify the value with one of the following: B (bytes), KB (kilobytes), MB (megabytes), GB (gigabytes) or "unlimited".

Base.Name: Name
Base.Description: The 'Name' parameter specifies the Name attribute for this mailbox. The Name attribute is used for the common name (CN) in Active Directory.

Base.Name: Office
Base.Description: The 'Office' parameter specifies the Microsoft Office attribute for this mailbox.

Base.Name: Primary SMTP address
Base.Description: The 'Primary SMTP address' parameter specifies the address that external users will see when they receive a message from this mailbox. When this parameter is used the 'Email addresses' parameter cannot be specified because 'Email addresses' includes the primary SMTP address.

Base.Name: Prohibit send quota
Base.Description: The 'Prohibit send quota' parameter parameter specifies the mailbox size at which the user associated with this mailbox can no longer send messages. Qualify the value with one of the following: B (bytes), KB (kilobytes), MB (megabytes), GB (gigabytes) or "unlimited". If this attribute is set on a mailbox, it overrides the default value that is set for this attribute on the mailbox database.

Base.Name: Prohibit send receive quota
Base.Description: The 'Prohibit send receive quota' parameter specifies the mailbox size at which the user associated with this mailbox can no longer send or receive messages. Qualify the value with one of the following: B (bytes), KB (kilobytes), MB (megabytes), GB (gigabytes) or "unlimited". If this attribute is set on a mailbox, it overrides the default value that is set for this attribute on the mailbox database.

Base.Name: Recipient limits
Base.Description: The 'Recipient limits' parameter specifies the maximum number of recipients per message to which this mailbox can send. Specify either an integer or "unlimited". If this attribute is set on a mailbox, it overrides the default value that is set for this attribute on the hub transport server.

Base.Name: Reject messages from
Base.Description: The 'Reject messages from' parameter specifies the recipients from whom messages will be rejected. Use for example: domain.com/Sales/JSmith. Use commas to specify multiple values.

Base.Name: Require sender authentication enabled
Base.Description: The 'RequireSenderAuthenticationEnabled' parameter specifies whether senders must be authenticated.

Base.Name: Retain deleted items for
Base.Description: The 'Retain deleted items for' parameter specifies the length of time to keep deleted items. To specify a value, enter it as a time span: dd.hh:mm:ss where d = days, h = hours, m = minutes, and s = seconds. For example, to specify a 15-hour interval, enter 15:00:00.

Base.Name: Retain deleted items until backup
Base.Description: The 'Retain deleted items until backup' parameter specifies whether to retain deleted items until the next backup.

Base.Name: Retention hold enabled
Base.Description: The 'Retention hold enabled' parameter specifies whether retention hold is enabled for MRM. To set the start date for retention hold, use the 'Start date for retention hold' parameter.

Base.Name: Rules quota
Base.Description: The 'Rules quota' parameter specifies the limit for the size of rules for this mailbox. Qualify the value with one of the following: B (bytes), KB (kilobytes), MB (megabytes), GB (gigabytes), TB (terabytes). Unqualified values are treated as bytes. The default value for this parameter is 64 KB. The maximum value for this parameter is 256 KB.

Base.Name: SamAccountName
Base.Description: The 'SamAccountName' parameter specifies the user name for earlier operating systems such as Windows NT 4.0, Windows 98, Windows 95, and LAN Manager. The parameter is used to support clients and servers running older versions of the operating system. This attribute must be less than 20 characters in length.

Base.Name: Simple display name
Base.Description: The 'Simple display name' parameter is used on objects where the name of the object may be displayed in an environment that does not support Unicode characters. The only supported characters for the SimpleDisplayName parameter are ASCII characters 26 through 126, inclusively. These characters are the ones that are typically found on most U.S. English keyboards.

Base.Name: Start date for retention hold
Base.Description: The 'Start date for retention hold' parameter specifies the start date for retention hold for MRM. To use this parameter, the 'Retention hold enabled' parameter must be set to Yes ($true).

Base.Name: Use database quota defaults
Base.Description: The 'Use database quota defaults' parameter specifies that this mailbox uses the quota attributes specified for the mailbox database where this mailbox resides. The quota attributes are: 'ProhibitSendQuota', 'ProhibitSendReceiveQuota', 'IssueWarningQuota' and 'RulesQuota'.

Base.Name: Use database retention defaults
Base.Description: The 'Use database retention defaults' parameter specifies that this mailbox uses the MailboxRetention attribute specified for the mailbox database where this mailbox resides.

Base.Name: User principal name
Base.Description: The 'User principal name' parameter specifies the user principal name (UPN) for this mailbox. This is the logon name for the user. The UPN consists of a user name and a suffix. Typically, the suffix is the domain name where the user account resides.

Base.Name: Windows emailaddress
Base.Description: The 'Windows emailaddress' parameter specifies the Windows e-mail address for this mailbox. This address is not used by Exchange.

Base.Explanation: Setup a session with the Powershell Agent service. The session is requied for a number of UMRA script actions that use the Powershell Agent service. See the online help for more information.

ArrayElement.Name: Session ID
ArrayElement.Description: The identifier of the Powershell Agent service session. The value should be stored in a variable that is used in subsequent UMRA acions thath use the Powershell Agent service session. This property is an 'output only' property. By default, the value for this property is stored in variable %PowershellAgentSessionId%.

Base.Explanation: Setup an Exchange session for PowerShell to manage an Exchange 2010 server.

Base.Name: Session ID
Base.Description: This parameter identifies the PowerShell Agent service session.

Base.Name: Connection URI
Base.Description: The Connection URI parameter specifies the location of the PowerShell. For example: 'https://[ExchangeServer].tools4ever.local/Powershell' or 'https://[ExchangeServer]/Powershell' or 'https://ps.outlook.com/powershell/'.

Base.Name: Credential User Name
Base.Description: Optional. The credential user name, use this parameter when you want to access the Exchange Server with an explicit account. The user name must be of an account inside the domain of the Exchange server and must have access to the Exchange server For example: 'tools4ever\JohnSmith'. If not specified, a default security context is tried for the specified authentication method, Generally this will be the security context of the Powershell Agent Service account.

Base.Name: Credential Password
Base.Description: Optional. The encrypted password of the account you want to use to access the Exchange server with. The input should be the encrypted value of the password.

Base.Name: Skip certificate check
Base.Description: With the 'Skip certificate check' parameter you can choose to connect to the exchange server without checking the certificate of the exchange server.

Base.Name: Skip prerequisites test
Base.Description: With the 'Skip prerequisites test' parameter you can choose to skip the check for PowerShell version, windows remoting version, execution policy. Set this only if you're completely sure the check fails, but the settings are correct.

Base.Name: Authentication
Base.Description: Specifies the mechanism that is used to authenticate the user's credentials. Valid values are "Default", "Basic", "Credssp", "Digest", "Kerberos", "Negotiate", and "NegotiateWithImplicitCredential". The default value is "Default".

Base.Name: Advanced: Logging mask
Base.Description: The mask specified here, determines the logging output of ALL the PowerShell actions in this session. Default all messages except debug messages are shown. The mask is build from the following numbers: 1 = Normal, 2 = Error, 4 = Warning, 8 = Info, 128 = Debug. If not specified the number 7 is used.

Base.Explanation: Edit the attributes of an existing mailbox.

Base.Name: Session ID
Base.Description: This parameter identifies the PowerShell Agent service session.

Base.Name: Domain controller
Base.Description: Optional value. The name of the domain controller used for reading or writing configuration changes. If not specified, Exchange will determine a domain controller. To prevent replication issues always use the same domain controller in the same session. Use the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the domain controller. For example 'EXCHSERVER.tools4ever.com'.

Base.Name: Identity
Base.Description: The identifier of the mailbox. Use for example the distinguished name 'CN=jsmith,OU=sales,DC=tools4ever,DC=com', the Windows Live Id 'jsmith@tools4everlive.com', the domain\account name 'tools4ever.com\Jsmith', the alias 'JSmith', the User principal name 'JSmith@tools4ever.com' or GUID.

Base.Name: Outlook Live: Password
Base.Description: The password used by Windows Live ID. This password is not the Active Directory user password. The value specified here will not be shown in the log.

Base.Name: Accept messages only from
Base.Description: The mailbox users, mail users and mail contacts that can send e-mail messages to this mailbox. Any of the following input formats is supported: the distinguished name 'CN=jsmith,OU=sales,DC=tools4ever,DC=com', the domain\account name 'tools4ever.com\Jsmith', the username 'JohnSmith', the alias 'JSmith', the display name 'John Smith', the user principal name 'JSmith@tools4ever.com' or the GUID. Specify a text-list for this parameter.

Base.Name: Accept messages only from distribution list members
Base.Description: The distribution lists from which messages are accepted.. Messages from any member of these distribution lists are accepted. Specify a text-list for this parameter.

Base.Name: Accept messages only from senders or members
Base.Description: The identity of recipients from whom messages are accepted. Specify a text-list for this parameter.

Base.Name: AddressBookPolicy (sp2)
Base.Description: Optional value.The AddressBookPolicy parameter specifies the address book policy that applies to this mailbox.

Base.Name: Alias
Base.Description: The Alias parameter specifies the alias (mail nickname) of the user. The alias can be a combination of characters separated by a period with no intervening spaces. Do not use special characters in the alias.

Base.Name: Arbitration
Base.Description: Set to 'Yes' to make the mailbox an arbitration mailbox. Arbitration mailboxes are used for managing approval workflow. For example, an arbitration mailbox is used for handling moderated recipients. When set to 'No' the current state will not change. The arbitration state cannot be removed. When not specified 'No' is assumed.

Base.Name: Arbitration Mailbox
Base.Description: The mailbox that is used to manage the moderation process.

Base.Name: Anti spam bypass enabled
Base.Description: Set to 'Yes' to skip anti-spam processing on this mailbox, or to 'No' otherwise. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 1
Base.Description: The value for the mailbox attribute CustomAttribute1.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 2
Base.Description: The value for the mailbox attribute CustomAttribute2.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 3
Base.Description: The value for the mailbox attribute CustomAttribute3.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 4
Base.Description: The value for the mailbox attribute CustomAttribute4.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 5
Base.Description: The value for the mailbox attribute CustomAttribute5.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 6
Base.Description: The value for the mailbox attribute CustomAttribute6.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 7
Base.Description: The value for the mailbox attribute CustomAttribute7.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 8
Base.Description: The value for the mailbox attribute CustomAttribute8.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 9
Base.Description: The value for the mailbox attribute CustomAttribute9.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 10
Base.Description: The value for the mailbox attribute CustomAttribute10.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 11
Base.Description: The value for the mailbox attribute CustomAttribute11.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 12
Base.Description: The value for the mailbox attribute CustomAttribute12.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 13
Base.Description: The value for the mailbox attribute CustomAttribute13.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 14
Base.Description: The value for the mailbox attribute CustomAttribute14.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 15
Base.Description: The value for the mailbox attribute CustomAttribute15.

Base.Name: Deliver to mailbox and forward
Base.Description: Set to 'Yes' to deliver messages to both this mailbox and the forwarding address, Set to 'No' to deliver the messages only at the forwarding address. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: Display name
Base.Description: The display name for the user account associated with this mailbox. The display name is used by Microsoft Outlook.

Base.Name: E-Mail addresses
Base.Description: The the proxy addresses of the mailbox. It includes the primary Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) address as one of the proxy addresses. Specify a text-list value for this parameter.

Base.Name: Emailaddress policy enabled
Base.Description: Set tot 'Yes' to enable the e-mail address policy for this mailbox. Set to 'No' to disable the policy. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: External Out of Office options
Base.Description: The option for sending an Out of Office message to external senders. Use one of the following values: 'External' or 'InternalOnly'.

Base.Name: Forwarding address
Base.Description: The forwarding address. For example 'domain.com/Sales/JSmith'. If 'Deliver to mailbox and forward' is set to 'Yes', messages that are sent to this mailbox will be forwarded to the address specified.

Base.Name: Hidden from addresslists enabled
Base.Description: Set to 'Yes' to hide this mailbox from other address lists, or to 'No' to unhide this mailbox. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: Issue warning quota
Base.Description: The mailbox size at which a warning message is sent to the user. Qualify the value with one of the following: 'B' (bytes), 'KB' (kilobytes), 'MB' (megabytes), 'GB' (gigabytes) or 'unlimited'. If this attribute is set on a mailbox, it overrides the default value that is set for this attribute on the mailbox database.

Base.Name: MailboxPlan (Outlook Live)
Base.Description: Optional value. This parameter is available only with the Outlook Live service. The MailboxPlan parameter specifies a mailbox plan for the mailbox.

Base.Name: Mail Tip
Base.Description: The message that is displayed to senders when they start drafting an e-mail message to this recipient. This message must be less than or equal to 250 characters.

Base.Name: Mail Tip Translations
Base.Description: The translations for the 'Mail tip' parameter. Each entry in the list must provide the locale, followed by a colon and the specific mail tip in that language. Each mail tip message must be less than or equal to 250 characters. Specify a text-list value for this parameter.

Base.Name: Maximum blocked senders
Base.Description: The maximum number of senders that can be included in the blocked senders list. Blocked senders are senders that are considered junk senders by the mailbox user and are used in junk e-mail rules. This parameter is only validated when the junk e-mail rules are updated using Outlook Web Access or Web services.

Base.Name: Maximum receive size
Base.Description: The maximum size of messages that this mailbox can receive. Qualify the value with one of the following: 'B' (bytes), 'KB' (kilobytes), 'MB' (megabytes), 'GB' (gigabytes) or 'unlimited'.

Base.Name: Maximum safe senders
Base.Description: The maximum number of senders that can be included in the safe senders list. Safe senders are senders that are trusted by the mailbox user and are used in junk e-mail rules. This parameter is only validated when the junk e-mail rules are updated using Outlook Web Access or Web services.

Base.Name: Maximum send size
Base.Description: The maximum size of messages that this mailbox can send. Qualify the value with one of the following: 'B' (bytes), 'KB' (kilobytes), 'MB' (megabytes), 'GB' (gigabytes) or 'unlimited'.

Base.Name: Moderated By
Base.Description: The users who are responsible for moderating the messages sent to this mailbox. This parameter is required if the 'Moderation Enabled' parameter is set to 'Yes'. Specify a text-list value for this parameter.

Base.Name: Moderation enabled
Base.Description: Set to 'Yes' to enable moderation or set to 'No' otherwise. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: Name
Base.Description: The name attribute for this mailbox. The name attribute is used for the common name (CN) in Active Directory.

Base.Name: Office
Base.Description: The Microsoft Office attribute for this mailbox.

Base.Name: Primary SMTP address
Base.Description: The address that external users will see when they receive a message from this mailbox. When this parameter is used the 'Email addresses' parameter cannot be specified because 'Email addresses' includes the primary SMTP address.

Base.Name: Prohibit send quota
Base.Description: The mailbox size at which the user associated with this mailbox can no longer send messages. Qualify the value with one of the following: 'B' (bytes), 'KB' (kilobytes), 'MB' (megabytes), 'GB' (gigabytes) or 'unlimited'. If this attribute is set on a mailbox, it overrides the default value that is set for this attribute on the mailbox database.

Base.Name: Prohibit send receive quota
Base.Description: The mailbox size at which the user associated with this mailbox can no longer send or receive messages. Qualify the value with one of the following: 'B' (bytes), 'KB' (kilobytes), 'MB' (megabytes), 'GB' (gigabytes) or 'unlimited'. If this attribute is set on a mailbox, it overrides the default value that is set for this attribute on the mailbox database.

Base.Name: Recipient limits
Base.Description: The maximum number of recipients per message to which this mailbox can send. Specify either an integer or 'unlimited'. If this attribute is set on a mailbox, it overrides the default value that is set for this attribute on the hub transport server.

Base.Name: Reject messages from
Base.Description: The recipients from whom messages will be rejected. Use for example 'domain.com/Sales/JSmith'. Specify a text-list value for this parameter.

Base.Name: Reject messages from distribution list members
Base.Description: The distribution lists from which message are rejected. Messages from any member of these distribution lists are rejected. Specify a text-list value for this parameter.

Base.Name: Reject messages from senders or members
Base.Description: The identity of recipients from whom messages are rejected. Specify a text-list value for this parameter.

Base.Name: Remove picture
Base.Description: Specify 'Yes' to remove the picture that a user has added to a mailbox, or 'No' to leave the picture untouched. If not specified 'No' is assumed.

Base.Name: Remove spoken name
Base.Description: Specify 'Yes' to remove the spoken name that a user has added to a mailbox, or 'No' to leave the spoken name untouched. If not specified 'No' is assumed.

Base.Name: Require sender authentication enabled
Base.Description: Set to 'Yes' to require senders to be authenticated. Set to 'No' to disable this requirement. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: Reset password on next logon
Base.Description: Set to 'Yes' to force the user to change the password at the next logon. Set to 'No' to let the user keep its current password. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: Retain deleted items for
Base.Description: The length of time to keep deleted items. To specify a value, enter it as a time span 'dd.hh:mm:ss'. Where 'd' = days, 'h' = hours, 'm' = minutes and 's' = seconds. For example, to specify a 15-hour interval, enter '15:00:00'.

Base.Name: Retain deleted items until backup
Base.Description: Set to 'Yes' to retain deleted items until the next backup. Set to 'No' otherwise. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: Retention comment
Base.Description: The comment that is displayed in Outlook regarding the user's retention hold status. This comment can only be set if the 'Retention Hold Enabled' parameter is set to 'Yes'. This comment should be localized to the user's preferred language.

Base.Name: Retention hold enabled
Base.Description: Set to 'Yes' to enable the retention hold for MRM. To set the start date for retention hold, use the 'Start date for retention hold' parameter, set to 'No' to disable. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: Retention policy
Base.Description: The name of a retention policy that must be applied to this mailbox. Retention policies consist of tags that are applied to mailbox folders and mail items to determine the period of time that the items should be retained.

Base.Name: Retention URL
Base.Description: The URL to an external Web page with additional details about the organization's messaging retention policies. This URL can be used to expose details regarding retention policies in general, which is usually a customized legal or IT Web site for the company.

Base.Name: Role Assignment policy
Base.Description: The RoleAssignmentPolicy parameter specifies the management role assignment policy to assign to the mailbox.

Base.Name: Rules quota
Base.Description: The size limit for the rules for this mailbox. Qualify the value with one of the following 'B' (bytes), 'KB' (kilobytes), 'MB' (megabytes), 'GB' (gigabytes), 'TB' (terabytes). Unqualified values are treated as bytes. The default value for this parameter is 64 KB. The quota for mailbox rules applies only to enabled rules. There is no restriction on the number of disabled rules a mailbox can have. However, the total size of rules that are enabled or active cannot exceed the value specified for this parameter.

Base.Name: SamAccountName
Base.Description: The user name for earlier operating systems such as 'Windows NT 4.0', 'Windows 98', 'Windows 95' and 'LAN Manager'. The parameter is used to support clients and servers running older versions of the operating system. This attribute must be less than 20 characters in length.

Base.Name: Simple display name
Base.Description: The simple display name is used on objects where the name of the object may be displayed in an environment that does not support Unicode characters. The only supported characters for this parameter are ASCII characters 26 through 126, inclusively. These characters are the ones that are typically found on most U.S. English keyboards.

Base.Name: SCL Delete Enabled
Base.Description: Set to 'Yes' to delete messages that meet the spam confidence level (SCL) threshold specified by the 'SCL Delete threshold' parameter, or to 'No' to keep them. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: SCL Delete Threshold
Base.Description: The SCL at which a message is deleted, if the 'SCL Delete Enabled' parameter is set to 'Yes'. The value must be between 0 and 9 inclusive. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: SCL Junk Enabled
Base.Description: Set to 'Yes' to move messages that meet the SCL threshold specified by the 'SCL Junk Threshold' parameter are to the Junk E-mail folder, or to 'No' otherwise. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: SCL Junk Threshold
Base.Description: The SCL Junk threshold. Messages with an SCL greater than the specified value, are moved to the Junk E-mail folder, if the 'SCL Junk Enabled' parameter is set to 'Yes'. The value must be between 0 and 9 inclusive. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: SCL Quarantine Enabled
Base.Description: Set to 'Yes' to quarantine messages that meet the SCL threshold specified by the 'SCL Quarantine Threshold' parameter, or to 'No' otherwise. If a message is quarantined, it's sent to the quarantine mailbox where the messaging administrator can review it. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: SCL Quarantine Threshold
Base.Description: The SCL at which a message is quarantined, if the 'SCL Quarantine Enabled' parameter is set to 'Yes'. The value must be between 0 and 9 inclusive. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: SCL Reject Enabled
Base.Description: Set to 'Yes' to reject messages that meet the SCL threshold specified by the 'SCL Reject Threshold' parameter are rejected. Set to 'No' otherwise. If a message is rejected, it's deleted and a rejection response is sent to the sender. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: SCL Reject Threshold
Base.Description: The SCL at which a message is rejected, if the 'SCL Reject Enabled' parameter is set to 'Yes'. Specify a value between 0 and 9 inclusive. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: Start date for retention hold
Base.Description: The start date for retention hold for MRM. To use this parameter, the 'Retention hold enabled' parameter must be set to 'Yes'. If not specified or when set to 'Never' this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: Use database quota defaults
Base.Description: Set to 'Yes' to use the quota attributes specified for the mailbox database where this mailbox resides, or set to 'No' to disable this functionality. The quota attributes are: 'ProhibitSendQuota', 'ProhibitSendReceiveQuota', 'IssueWarningQuota' and 'RulesQuota'. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: Use database retention defaults
Base.Description: Set to 'Yes' to specify that this mailbox uses the 'MailboxRetention' attribute specified for the mailbox database where this mailbox resides, or set to 'No' the use the values specified with this mailbox instead of the database defaults. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: User principal name
Base.Description: The user principal name ('UPN') for this mailbox. This is the logon name for the user. The UPN consists of a user name and a suffix. Typically, the suffix is the domain name where the user account resides.

Base.Name: Windows e-mail address
Base.Description: The windows e-mail address for this mailbox. This address is not used by Exchange.

Base.Explanation: Closes the Exchange session inside the current Powershell session. Use the action Release Powershell Agent service session to subsequently release the Powershell session itself.

Base.Name: Session ID
Base.Description: This parameter identifies the PowerShell Agent service session.

Base.Explanation: Release a session with the Powershell Agent service. The session should be previously setup with action 'Setup Powershell Agent service session'. The session is identified by property 'Session ID'.

ArrayElement.Name: Session ID
ArrayElement.Description: The identifier of the Powershell Agent service session. The value should correspond with property 'Session ID' of action 'Setup Powershell Agent service session', called previously.
